posts.title: Whores’ Glory
posts.excerpt: Quote: Tells several stories of prostitution around the world. The documentary revolves around the lives and individual hopes, needs and experiences of the women.

posts._title: Mikhail Kalatozov – Neotpravlennoye pismo aka The Letter Never Sent (1960) (HD)
posts.title: Neotpravlennoye pismo
posts.excerpt: Quote: After months of searching, four devoted geologists unearth diamonds in Bolshaya Zemlya. Subsequently cut off from the outside world – and their food supply – by a raging forest fire, the team fights for their lives while attempting to pass along the location of the priceless cache.

posts._title: Jaime Humberto Hermosillo – La tarea prohibida aka Forbidden Homework (1992)
posts.title: La tarea prohibida
posts.excerpt: In this provocative drama from Mexican filmmaker Jaime Humberto Hermosillo, Julian Pastor plays a young college student who is living with his aunt. The student is taking a course in filmmaking and is working on a short video as a class project. An attractive middle-aged woman, Marieda (Maria Rojo), arrives to audition for a part …

posts.title: Jestem twój
posts.excerpt: Marta, a 30-year-old doctor, loses control over her life. She pushes away her loving husband. One day she meets by chance Artur, a young criminal, who falls deeply in love with her. posts._title: Selton Mello – O Palhaço AKA The Clown (2011)
posts.title: O Palhaço
posts.excerpt: This is the story of father and son who work as clowns Puro Sangue/Valdemar (Paulo Jose) and Pangare/Benjamin (Selton Mello) in a circus which travels through the Brazilian country side. Benjamin is a clown who does not have id or social security number. Going through a phase where he starts questioning his ability to make …

posts._title: Tatu Pohjavirta – Collected Shorts of Tatu Pohjavirta (1999 – 2005)
posts.title: Collected Shorts of Tatu Pohjavirta (1999 – 2005)
posts.excerpt: This is some absolutely gorgeous animation. Not all of the shorts on here are top-notch, but nearly all are worth viewing – especially Reflector, a short which is easily worth the entire torrent all by itself. I put this collection up there with Blood Tea and Red String in terms of stop-motion quality, even if …

posts._title: George Stevens – A Place in the Sun [+Extras] (1951)
posts.title: A Place in the Sun
posts.excerpt: Greatest Films wrote: A Place in the Sun (1951) is a powerful social drama and romance from director/producer George Stevens. The black and white film plays on the audience’s emotions, by involving and drawing them into complicity with the tragic resolution. Methodically, the film is stylistically dark, almost with film-noirish qualities, yet it has some …

posts._title: André Antoine – L’Hirondelle et la mésange (1920)
posts.title: L’Hirondelle et la mésange
posts.excerpt: André Antoine and the Realist Tradition After its humiliating defeat in the 1870 Franco-Prussian War, France went through a social revolution. Over the next twenty years, many of its long-standing artistic traditions, such as the classical style of Academy painting, would be cast off in favor of new approaches, such as Impressionism. posts.title: Os Cafajestes
posts.excerpt: Quote: A Brazilian masterpiece, fascinating, powerful and still contemporary, waiting to be (re)discovered by the world, 12 October 2006 The first thing you’ll remark when you see “Os Cafajestes” today (if you are lucky enough to find a copy of it) is how surprisingly modern, daring and mesmerizing it still is.
